{{also|gluck|Gluck|glück}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{der|de|gmh|gelücke}} (12th century), at first along the Lower and Middle Rhine. Borrowed from {{der|de|odt|*gilukki}} as part of the Flemish knight culture; compare {{cog|dum|gelucke}} (1240), whence modern {{cog|nl|geluk}}. (The fact that the word is attested in High German before Dutch, must be disregarded in view of the minimal attestation of Old Dutch as a whole.) Further origin unknown. Theories include a relation with {{m+|nl|luiken|t=to close}} in the sense of “that which is concluded, determined”, or with {{m+|de|gelingen|t=to succeed}}, which is not attested in Dutch, however.
